DOC.brief_summary: The study hypothesis is that the release of gut hormones is increased proportionally to caloric load in each meal. Three different meals with different meal size will therefore be served and gut hormones determined.
DOC.brief_title: Gut Hormones After Meal Ingestion in Males Versus Females
DOC.detailed_description: In healthy males and females, meals with 511, 743 and 1034 kcal will be given orally. Samples will be taken during the following 300 min and gut hormones (glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide and glucagon-like peptide-1) will be determined along with insulin and glucagon levels.
DOC.criteria: Healthy status Diabetes Liver disease kidney disease thyroid disease
